result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brianna M. Schmelling

records.addlTxt:
9:49 a.m.
Clerk Micki. 
INCLUDES 22CM167 and 22CM587.

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Peter Vu.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed. 
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
22CM167
COUNT 2: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misd >> DRI.
22CM587
COUNT 1: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Bail Jumping - Misd >> DRI. 

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to: 
22CM167
COUNT 1: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) >> GUILTY.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: $50.00 fine; CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. 

Adj: 9:58 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Calendar call on September 22, 2022 at 08:05 am.

9:05 AM 
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CM167 and 22CM587

State appears by ADA Hannah Runde; Defendant fails to appears; Attorney Adam Fontana appears for Attorney Peter Vu.

Date and time set for a JPTC.

ADA Runde notes Defendant has Covid and request for the JPTC to be rescheduled.
Atty Fontana makes statement - ready for a plea/sentencing. Defendant tested positive for Covid.
COURT sets CC for 9/15/22 at 8:05 a.m.

CC - 9/15/22 at 8:05 a.m.

ADJ: 9:07 a.m.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:40p.m.
Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 22CM587 and 22CM167

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Peter Vu.

Date and time set for a JPTC. 

Atty Peter Vu makes statement regarding cases.  Anticipates resolution. Would like a JPTC/TPD about a month out.


NEXT DATE:
JPTC/TPD - 9/12/22 at 9:00a.m.

ADJ: 1:36p.m.

ADDRESS INFO for Brianna M. Schmelling
Current: 3200 Hilltop Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 224637 Country Lane, Wausau, WI 54401
Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 9:33 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  Not Guilty by Court. 

COURT ORDERS: $250 sig bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No driving without valid dl. 
- Prints and photograph. 

BRANCH 6 CASE. 
JPTC on 7/18/2022 at 1:40 pm.
